intro: Polyscias letestui, commonly known as the New Caledonian holly, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, tropical conditions and is often found in forest understories, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
